topic: former glp-1 users regain lost weight after about 18 months, study says

text: If you're one of the millions of people who have used GLP-1 medications to lose weight, a new study has some surprising news for you
You might regain all that lost weight in about a year and a half after stopping the treatment
The study found that former GLP-1 users typically start to regain weight around six to twelve months after they stop taking the medication
With the weight gain accelerating over time
By eighteen months after stopping GLP-1 treatment, the average person in the study had regained all of the weight they had lost
The study's findings were based on data from a large group of people who had used GLP-1 medications for weight loss
And the results were consistent across different demographics and age groups
But what's still unclear is why this weight regain happens
And whether there are any strategies that can help prevent it
So further research is needed to understand the long-term effects of GLP-1 treatment
And how to maintain weight loss over time
To find a solution to this problem
And to help people achieve their weight loss goals
